ratings.comment: Had him for Ballet II. Would recommend him, focuses a lot on technique, and not combinations. Has a hard accent to understand, so make sure to listen!

Vivian is a cranky guy who has a fairly strong accent, making him difficult to understand. The class isn't that hard, but it isn't paced well so you will be forced to cram a lot in the last month or so. The other crappy part is that for ANY Dance 41 class you have to attend 3 outside dances and write 2 papers based off shows you have to go see.

Funny guy. He is cranky at times and you do the same steps over and over. He'll say we'll start from where we left off but you start over. We spent 2 months on the waltz and had only couple days at the end of the semester to learn swing and tango. Very easy to get an A, but if you want to actually learn dancing, I would take a different professor.

Pretty soft spoken, hard to understand sometimes. Great ballet teacher nonetheless. I've taken ballet for 7 years and I took Ballet 2, and after the first week or so I could already feel my turnout and basic foundational technique improving.

Favorite class ever!  You learn so much and have fun too.  He's kind of quiet and difficult to understand at times but SUPER funny!  Remember to "step away from the wall, you're going to trip on all of these bags."

I started taking his non credit classes 25 years ago and fell in love with ballet. I am still dancing today and have many fond memories of my 9 years in Mr. Tomlinson's class. I remember the many records and him standing behind the piano playing while we jete'd across the room.

I adore Professor Tomlinson. I have taken ballet with him for 3 years. He can be abrasive and harsh but if you take what he says seriously, you will improve immensely. Besides being a wonderful teacher, he also has a quirky side that shines through when he breaks off into his funny stories .about meeting one of the beach boys or home in South Afric

All of the negative comments for Vivian are most likely coming from people who don't try very hard! Even if he criticizes what you do, if you show that you're trying- he absolutely loves you! I understand that it's only a 1 credit class, but if ballet is important to you at all, you can take a lot away from him.
Vivian has a sense of humor thats to be appreciated and a great talent!  He is a great teacher and tests to the correct level.  I learned so much and had fun doing it!  Easy A.

This teacher is horrible. I love ballet and this techer was completely unhelpful and really lowered my self-confidence. You can barely understand him because he speaks so low. He criticizes people throughout the class and does NOT do a good job in letting you know when the finals are. Don't waste your time taking this class- it's not worth it.

Vivian can seem really cranky and unhappy but dont let him get you down. He gets frustrated when people make the same mistakes and when you "dont listen." If you pay attention, practice, and are willing to learn and fix mistakes, he will like you. He's pretty strict but its because he wants to make sure you get the basics correct. Hes a greatteachr

vivian is awesome- seriously. ballroom dance is so easy! you pretty much just show up and dance. best moment of semester- warming up to "it's raining men." he's really funny even though he can seem a little mean at times.

Vivian is a tough customer, yes. He yells and gets crabby, but he's also very funny. He demands that you pay attention, try hard, and ask questions. If he does get testy, so what? Don't take it personally. Keep in mind that he's thousands of miles from his friends and family in South Africa, so give him a break if he's having a rough day!

I loved this guy as a ballet teacher -- he was a lot of fun and even though he yelled sometimes, it was cool.  I mean, it's a classical ballet class, it's meant to be rigorous.  If you can't take the heat... get out of the kitchen.  Oh yeah... don't be fooled by the Vivian -- he's definitely a guy.

If you know nothing about ballet this can be difficult.  I took this class cuz it fit in my sched.  he is a great teacher but you need some ballet backround or its hard to get what he is talking about.  Go have fun and dont take it too seriously!

vivian, the male ballerina, may know a lot about ballet as a science but knows nothing of it as an art form.  his modeling and abilities would be a hit on saturday night live.  always crabby, unenthusiastic.  don't waste your time.
Fun class, but hard to learn.  He gets frustrated and angry if you don't understand right away.
